page.title: 04Ecology 3
page.content: We are lucky to have a woodland at the top of our school field. In that area there are 200 shrubs and trees which were planted by the children in 1983. They were all indigenous species.These are some of them; ash, field maple, rowan, larch, wild cherry, birch, oak, guelder rose, dogwood, holly and hawthorn. In the woodland there are all sorts of plants including; spear thistle, fox_ glove, poppy, ragwort, nettles, dock, dandelion, speedwell, buttercup and daisy. Grasses include cocksfoot, rye, crested dogtail, scutch, foxtail, meadow soft and meadow grass. The idea of the woodland is to make a nature reserve in the grounds. After 2 years we have badgers using it as a dung pit. The woodland is a great play area. We have already built a den.
